instruction: Stab your fingers deep into the rice and then make a fist. Retract. Repeat.
motivation: This is my hand. I want it strong.
title: Iron Fist

instruction: Stab your fingers deep into the rice and then open your hand wide. Retract, palms away from you. Repeat.
motivation: Your hand is afraid of the rice. The rice should be afraid of your hand.
title: Screaming Talon

instruction: Embed fists deep in rice. Rotate one direction.
motivation: Do not worry that you cannot see. Fear is the only darkness. Breathe.
title: Fists of Fury

instruction: Embed fist deep in rice. Rotate other direction.
motivation: Seek not to know the answers, but to understand the questions.
title: Fists of Fury, Part II

instruction: Embed fists deep in rice. Move fists side to side.
motivation: Do not think. Feel. Focus on the art of climbing without climbing.
title: Wax on, Wax off

instruction: Embed fists deep in rice.  Move fists up and down.
title: Paint the Fence

instruction: On the surface, snatch rice quickly with your fingers over and over.  Keep your form.
motivation: The rice has only images and illusions behind which it hides its true motives.  Destroy the image and you will break the rice.  Do not spill rice on floor.
title: Snatch the Pebble

instruction: On surface push rice away with fingers.
motivation: Stay under control while you reflect on life failures. Spill rice on floor at your own peril.
title: Magic Palm

instruction: Dig your thumbs deep into the rice repeatedly.
motivation: Remember that you learn most about life from your greatest enemies.
title: Gouge the Eye

instruction: Stab rice with fingers together and claw at it.
motivation: Do not be tender. An eagle can break a wolf's back with one strike.
title: Eagle Claw

instruction: Grab handfuls of rice and attempt to make gruel out of it, quickly and repeatedly.
motivation: Only the undisciplined spill rice on the floor. Control the rice. It is your destiny.
title: Crush the Pebble

instruction: Lightly caress handfuls of rice, move into your most powerful stance, then squeeze.
motivation: In time you will learn to absorb the essence of the rice. It is only then that you will be truly powerful.
title: Essence Absorbing Stance
